sections.title: Who I Am
content: I’m Tian Pretorius, a software engineer who enjoys turning complex problems into systems that work reliably. Over the past five years, I’ve built tools and applications that improve workflows, automate processes, and make data more actionable.

My experience spans software development, automation, and projects that bring hardware and software together. I focus on connecting technical concepts with practical applications, creating systems that are dependable, maintainable, and straightforward to use.

sections.title: What I Do
sections.intro: I design and build scalable, reliable systems, with a focus on:
list: Database design and scalable data management
System design, security, and protocol implementation
Leading projects, collaborating across teams, and solving complex technical problems

sections.title: My Approach
content: I see engineering as a mix of problem-solving and craft. I break problems into smaller pieces, explore different solutions, and refine systems until they function smoothly. Maintainability, scalability, and usability guide my work, ensuring solutions continue to perform over time.

Collaboration is an important part of my process. I incorporate feedback, test ideas in practice, and adjust when necessary. Balancing technical rigor with practical results helps me build systems that are effective and usable in real-world contexts.

sections.title: Highlights from My Journey
content: I enjoy working on challenging problems that require thoughtful solutions and careful design. I’m motivated by building systems that are reliable, adaptable, and easy to work with.

Continuous learning and experimentation are central to my practice. I value projects where technical depth meets practical outcomes, and I appreciate working with teams that focus on problem-solving and steady improvement.

sections.title: What Excites Me
content: My journey began in computer and electronic engineering, where I developed a foundation in programming, data analysis, and system design. Early projects sparked my interest in connecting software to physical systems through prototypes, automation, and data-driven tools.

Since then, I’ve worked in R&D, full-stack development, and automation. I’ve developed precision analysis tools, optimized production workflows, and prototyped integrated systems. Each project reinforced the importance of creating solutions that are both technically sound and practical to use.

items.title: CTO & Software Engineer
items.description: Developed vitamin premixes for nutrition and food fortification; optimized production lines for compliance; consulted on global fortification projects; managed and optimized sourcing operations.

items.title: Computer/Solution Engineer
items.description: Built automation systems for micronutrient production and quality assurance, implemented secure and compliant processes, and provided R&D support and technical system development.

items.title: Lead/R&D Engineer
items.description: Developed vitamin testing platforms, including particle recognition algorithms for detecting vitamin A in sugar crystals. Deployed software across web and mobile platforms, bridging research with practical industrial applications.

aboutPreview.intro: I’m a curious engineer who loves turning ideas into systems that work seamlessly. Whether it’s improving workflows, creating data-driven tools, or designing applications that solve real problems, I’m driven by the challenge of connecting technical concepts with practical outcomes.
paragraphs: Over the past five years, I’ve built solutions that span the full spectrum of engineering — from prototyping embedded systems to architecting scalable software platforms. This has taught me how to bridge theory and practice, ensuring that every system I design is both reliable and adaptable in real-world environments.

I approach every project with a focus on experimentation, iteration, and thoughtful design. I enjoy refining systems until they feel effortless to use, uniting technical depth with usability, and finding creative ways to make complex problems simpler and more maintainable.

At my core, I’m motivated by collaboration and impact. I love working on projects that combine innovation with tangible results, where software and technology come together to create meaningful solutions. If you’re building something ambitious, I’m excited to help bring it to life.
